Package ohos.utils

Class LongPlainArray<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.utils.LongPlainArray<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - Indicates the type of the value to be stored.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable

    public class LongPlainArray<E>
extends Object
implements Cloneable
    A basic collection class to store the data structures that use the primitive data type long as the key and any object as the value.

    Values in this class are directly stored in arrays, without being wrapped into other types. This simplifies the data storage structure and saves memory. All key-value pairs in this class are sorted in ascending order when they are stored, and the binary search algorithm is used to efficiently search for a specified key. In such data storage structures, keys and values can be iterated over based on indexes. This class implements the Cloneable interface and supports shallow copy of stored values.

    Pay attention to the following when using the LongPlainArray class:

    • This class is non-thread safe.
    • The stored value cannot be a null object.
    • Values are not stored in the same sequence as they are inserted.
    Since:
    1

      • LongPlainArray

        public LongPlainArray​(int capacity)
        A constructor used to create a LongPlainArray instance with a custom initial capacity.

        This constructor allows you to customize the initial capacity of the LongPlainArray object.

        Parameters:
        capacity - Indicates the initial capacity to customize for the object.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the specified capacity is less than or equal to 0.

    • Method Detail

      • locate

        public int locate​(long key)
        Searches for the index of a specified key.

        The binary search algorithm is used for searching. If no result is found, a negative value is returned. However, you can invert this negative value to obtain the index where the key should be stored in the array.

        Parameters:
        key - Indicates the key to search for.
        Returns:
        Returns the index of the key; returns a negative value if no result is found.

      • indexOfKey

        public int indexOfKey​(long key)
        Queries the index for a specified key.
        Parameters:
        key - Indicates the key to query.
        Returns:
        Returns the index for the key; returns INVALID_INDEX if the queried key does not exist.

      • indexOfValue

        public int indexOfValue​(E value)
        Queries the index for a specified value.
        Parameters:
        value - Indicates the value to query.
        Returns:
        Returns the index for the value; returns INVALID_INDEX if the queried value does not exist.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if the queried value is null.

      • put

        public void put​(long key,
                E value)
        Adds a key-value pair to LongPlainArray.

        If the specified key already exists, its value will be replaced by value.

        Parameters:
        key - Indicates the key to be added.
        value - Indicates the value associated with the key.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if value is null.

                       E value)

        Parameters:

        value - Indicates the value associated with the key.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Throws this exception if the specified index is beyond the valid range.
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if the specified value is null.

      • append

        public void append​(long key,
                   E value)
        Appends a key-value pair to LongPlainArray.

        If the key to be added is greater than any existing key in the array, this method is more efficient than the put(long,java.lang.Object) method. If the specified key is not the largest one in the array, the put(long,java.lang.Object) method is automatically called to add the key-value pair.

        Parameters:
        key - Indicates the key to be added.
        value - Indicates the value associated with the key.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if value is null.

      • remove

        public Optional<E> remove​(long key)
        Removes the key-value pair based on a specified key.
        Parameters:
        key - Indicates the key to remove.
        Returns:
        Returns an Optional object containing the removed value; returns an empty Optional object if key does not exist.

      • removeAt

        public E removeAt​(int index)
        Removes the key-value pair of a specified index.
        Parameters:
        index - Indicates the index of the key-value pair to remove.
        Returns:
        Returns an Optional object with the removed value encapsulated.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Throws this exception if the specified index is beyond the valid range.

      • clone

        public LongPlainArray<E> clone​()
        Obtains a clone of the current LongPlainArray object.

        Note that values stored in the array are shallowly copied.

      • toString

        public String toString​()
        Obtains the string format of the LongPlainArray object.

        The returned string format is JSON-compliant, and the values in JSON name/value pairs are returned by toString() method of every elements in the LongPlainArray object.

        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        Returns the JSON-based string format of LongPlainArray.
